title: Where's the Setup Button on the New Xfinity Remote?

steps.title: It’s on the bottom left or top right of your Xfinity remote.
steps.content: It’s on the bottom left or top right of your Xfinity remote. The silver remotes have an oval-shaped gray setup bottom on the top right of the remote. If you have an XR2, XR5, or XR11, it's a small gray circle or square on the bottom left. [1] X Research source Some XR2 or XR5 don't have setup buttons. If you don't see one on yours, don't worry! You can either use the microphone feature to follow on-screen prompts or use the Xfinity button to enter a specific manufacturer's code. Check out the owner's manual that came with your remote.

steps.title: There is no setup button on voice-controlled Xfinity remotes.
steps.content: There is no setup button on voice-controlled Xfinity remotes. The XR15 and XR16 remotes use vocal commands to change channels or access the content you want. To get your XR15 or XR16 to work with your TV or streaming box, you'll need to pair the remote with it. Check your owner's manual for specifics on how to pair either the XR15 or XR15 with your TV or Xfinity Flex streaming box. [2] X Research source In some cases, you can press the microphone button and follow the on-screen instructions to pair your remote.

steps.title: Look on the package or check out https://www.xfinity.com/support/remotes.
steps.content: Look on the package or check out https://www.xfinity.com/support/remotes . Usually, Xfinity remotes start with an XR followed by a number. If you don't see this on the remote package, pull up Xfinity's support page for remotes. You'll see a photo of each remote along with the product name. Currently, Xfinity has these remotes: [3] X Research source Voice remotes: XR11, XR15, XR16 XR2, XR5 Silver with red or gray OK-select button

steps.title: Press the setup button and hold it down.
steps.content: Press the setup button and hold it down. Keep pressing the button until it blinks twice or the LED on the top of the remote turns from red to green. [4] X Research source If you don't see any light at all on your remote, check the batteries before you try again.

steps.title: Type in the 4- or 5-digit setup code.
steps.content: Type in the 4- or 5-digit setup code. Check your owner's manual for a setup code that's specific to your remote and television. It's usually 4 or 5 digits long. Once you enter the code, it should blink twice to show that the remote is successfully paired. [5] X Research source If you see 1 long blink or the light is red, try again using another 4- or 5-digit code.

steps.title: Manually enter a custom code to pair the XR15 remote to your TV.
steps.content: Manually enter a custom code to pair the XR15 remote to your TV. Press the "Xfinity" button and "mute" buttons at the same time for 5 seconds. When the light turns green, enter the 5-digit code that's listed for your TV manufacturer. The green light should blink twice. Then, you can point the remote at your TV and press the power button. [6] X Research source If the light blinks red, then green, try the next TV manufacturer device code listed in your owner's manual.

steps.title: Use the microphone feature to pair the XR16 remote to your TV.
steps.content: Use the microphone feature to pair the XR16 remote to your TV. Press the "Xfinity" button to get to the settings menu. Then, push the "Voice" button to access the microphone. Say, "Remote settings," and choose "voice remote pairing." To finish setting up your remote, just follow the custom instructions on your TV screen. [7] X Research source This works for the XR16 remote.

steps.title: Press down the "info" and "home" buttons at the same time for 5 seconds.
steps.content: Press down the "info" and "home" buttons at the same time for 5 seconds. Hold both down until the light on your remote blinks. Then, press "power," "last," and "volume down" in order to finish the reset. [8] X Research source You may want to reset your remote if you're pairing it to a different television. This works for most Xfinity remotes like the XR2, XR5, silver remotes, and XR15.

steps.title: Press the A and D button if you have an XR15 remote.
steps.content: Press the A and D button if you have an XR15 remote. The A button is shaped like a triangle and the D button is shaped like a diamond. Press both simultaneously and hold them until the light turns from red to green. Then, press the numbers 9, 8, 1 to finish the reset. [9] X Research source It usually takes around 5 seconds for the light to turn green. The A and D buttons are located around the middle of the remote.
